title: 110_hr4120
content: The table of contents outlines the sections of the Effective Child Pornography Prosecution Act of 2007 and the Enhancing the Effective Prosecution of Child Pornography Act of 2007. It includes short titles, findings, and provisions related to banning child pornography and enhancing prosecution efforts. The "Effective Child Pornography Prosecution Act of 2007" aims to address the global issue of child pornography, highlighting the prevalence of images involving children as young as 3 years old. The distribution of such images perpetuates the abuse of the victims and is easily accessible through various internet technologies. The Internet facilitates the distribution of child pornography through various means like messaging, chat rooms, and peer-to-peer networks. The ease, low cost, and anonymity of online distribution have led to a surge in the spread of child pornography across jurisdictions. The transmission of child pornography online is considered interstate commerce. Amendments have been made to clarify the ban on child pornography in the United States Code. Amendments have been made to the United States Code to clarify the ban on child pornography, specifically by inserting language regarding the use of interstate or foreign commerce in various subsections and sections. Amendments to the United States Code clarify the ban on child pornography by adding language about using interstate or foreign commerce in different subsections and sections. Amendments to the United States Code clarify the ban on child pornography by adding language about using interstate or foreign commerce in different subsections and sections of Chapter 110 of title 18. Amendments to the United States Code expand the ban on child pornography by including the use of interstate or foreign commerce in various sections. The Child Pornography Act of 2007 enhances the prosecution of child pornography by expanding the ban to include the use of interstate or foreign commerce. The "Enhancing the Effective Prosecution of Child Pornography Act of 2007" includes amendments to money laundering laws related to child pornography and addresses knowingly accessing child pornography with the intent to view. Amendments are made to Section 2252A(a)(5) of title 18, United States Code, regarding possessing or accessing child pornography with intent to view. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
